text: now it's time to season you're burned
you've got them in the pan if you've
bought a kosher turkey he's come pre
brined you don't have to Brian if you
want to brine your turkey you need two
cups of kosher salt for one gallon of
water this turkey needs about two
gallons of water bring it to a simmer
dissolve the salt and any seasonings you
want sugar aromatics submerge the bird
put it in the fridge for one to two days
he needs to stay below 40 degrees while
he's in the brine solution otherwise
bacteria could grow or you can do what I
do which is something called a dry brine
I'm using a half a teaspoon of kosher
salt per pound of Turkey I've mixed in
some pepper some citrus zest and some
rosemary and you rub it on the bird make
sure to season inside the cavity that's
really important you want to rub it all
around in there little massage on the
legs you put it in the fridge and let it
sit overnight uncovered if you don't
have time to put it in the fridge
overnight and let the seasonings work in
he's ready to go you can trust him stuff
him and roast him
